body: Which view(s) specifically?
Since the resulting table name is 'expr_qry' if we use subquery, how can we create slices from the data table with subquery? Any recommended documentation.. ?
Managed to configure this. We need to remove the original table name from metric formula. Happy to add them in documentations and will do PR.

After some googling it seems like an uglify problem
That's mysql specific, if you are not using it you don't need them.

I am having a similar problem: HTTP works perfectly, but when I config ALB with HTTPS, always get error 502 Bad gateway. 

I have tried:
set ENABLE_PROXY_FIX = True in superset_config,
and set FORWARDED_ALLOW_IPS=* as Environment variable, 

but not luck.

FYI, my Gunicon version is 19.7.1, superset is 0.18.5.

I am wondering whether there is anything else I can try? I tried to replicate the error locally with haproxy, but it seems that haproxy does not have the problem, only ALB has this error. I have sent the whole days on it, but no progress at all. Any help and tips are appreciated !

Thanks
Jay

I am having similar problem: ALB works find with HTTP, but when I binding HTTPS to the ALB, I get error: 502 Bad Gateway. I have tried to figure out more details about the error, but not much information logged in S3. Is there anywhere I can see more information about this error? There is no any error from the superset console. I suspect the problem happens in ALB, some headers not matched maybe?

 and I have tried ENABLE_PROXY_FIX = True in superset_config.py and also environment variable FORWARDED_ALLOW_IPS=*, but not luck.

my Gunicon version is 19.7.1, superset is 0.18.5.

Any suggestion or tip is appreciated! Thanks

Jay

I was having the same issue on 0.19.0 using Presto.  Writing explicit queries in SQLLab worked, but using the dropdowns, results shows "argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable".  The same error occurred creating slices.

I was able to fix this with a change in my datasource SQLAlchemy URI.  Previously, I had used 'presto://hive@localhost:port/'.  I'm able to create slices after changing to 'presto://hive@localhost:<port>/<presto_catalog_name>/<hive_db_name>'

We use react-grid-layout which has a responsive grid. On small screen it has less columns (8 instead of 12 I believe) and that forces the layout to change. Dashboards may have to be designed with that in mind.

I'm not sure what else we can do to accommodate small screens, ideas are welcomed.

Try add
```
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
```

to head section - may be it helps

hey @timifasuba....the method I use is using pandas to transform the
data...all this is done on the server (back end), then I put the data in
sqlite as a .db file...see below code that if you replicate you will easily
import any csv, after you do this....then go to superset data
sources-databases and input 'sqlite///sites_4g.db' (in my example below I
created a db with name sites_4g.db)

import pandas as pd
pdsites = pd.read_csv("site_data.csv")
pdsites.columns


def df2sqlite(dataframe, db_name = "import.sqlite", tbl_name = "import"):

    import sqlite3
    conn=sqlite3.connect(db_name)
    cur = conn.cursor()

    wildcards = ','.join(['?'] * len(dataframe.columns))
    data = [tuple(x) for x in dataframe.values]

    cur.execute("drop table if exists %s" % tbl_name)

    col_str = '"' + '","'.join(dataframe.columns) + '"'
    cur.execute("create table %s (%s)" % (tbl_name, col_str))

    cur.executemany("insert into %s values(%s)" % (tbl_name, wildcards),
data)

    conn.commit()
    conn.close()

df2sqlite(pdsites, db_name="sites_4g.db", tbl_name = "sites_data_4g")


import sqlite3
import pandas as pd
# Create your connection.
cnx = sqlite3.connect('sites_4g.db')

df = pd.read_sql_query("SELECT * FROM sites_data_4g", cnx)
df.head(5)

####Then go to superset data sources-databases and input
'sqlite///sites_4g.db'

I've just checked SQLAlchemy's `inspector.get_table_names()` and `inspector.get_view_names` and unfortunately using these two just giving back empty strings instead of the table names no matter if I specify the schema parameter or not.

If `SHOW TABLES` works, then someone should debug `self.identifier_preparer.quote_identifier`? https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/blob/79285a0f466279f786bcfec89f5a202fb2085d9a/lib/sqlalchemy/sql/compiler.py#L2954
